title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$\frac{3\text{mol} \text{Ca(OH)}_2}{2\text{mol} \text{H}_3\text{PO}_4}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\text{Ca}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: The molar amount of $$\text{Ca}\left(OH\right) _2$$ is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$H_3 PO_4$$ by the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\text{Ca}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: What is $$1.36\text{mol}\text{H}_3\text{PO}_4\times\frac{3 \text{mol}\text{Ca(OH)}_2}{2\text{mol}\text{H}_3\text{PO}_4}?$$ Keep two decimal places.
